title: Request for emails, UCSF

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Request for emails, UCSF
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All email communications from jolson@chla.usc.edu to UCSF or from UCSF to jolson@chla.usc.edu from the time period of July of 2016 thru March 6, 2024.  

jolson@chla.usc.edu is the email of the NIH funded researcher Johanna Olson.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Laidlaw

title: Erik van Sabben (31 January 1972 - 16 January 2009)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Erik van Sabben (31 January 1972 - 16 January 2009)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or pertaining to the late Dutch businessman Erik van Sabben (31 January 1972 - 16 January 2009) including (but not limited to) any and all records of border crossing, travel, or secondary screening.

Van Sabben was the business development manager of Dubai's TTS International. A recent news report by Volkskrant (https://volkskrant.nl/nieuws-achtergrond/aivd-speelde-cruciale-rol-bij-sabotage-kernprogramma-iran~ba24df9f/) named him as a Dutch intelligence asset.

Van Sabben's death was widely reported (https://www.thenationalnews.com/uae/engineer-who-helped-build-the-maqta-bridge-1.553285). As such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: TPD Records General (audio, video, etc.) :: R078694-030624
communications.communication:
Dear Demarcus Nottington: 
The City is in receipt of the below public records request and it will be forwarded to the appropriate department(s) for a response to determine if such a record(s) exists. All City records are open for personal inspection and copying by any person except for portions of records which contain exempt or confidential information which may not be disclosed unless otherwise permitted by law.  While the City strives to provide access to public records by remote electronic means, it is necessary that the records are reviewed for possible exempt or confidential information prior to disclosure.  Should the records contain exempt or confidential information that is required to be redacted, the City will need to bill for the time expended on making the necessary redactions.  Should any extraordinary time be required, the City charges administrative fees as authorized by Florida Statutes.  An estimate of charges will be provided for prepayment prior to work being processed. 
 
Record Types: 
Other Departmental Records 
Police Case Number: 
Additional Information: 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the City of Tampa Public Records Center. 
City of Tampa Public Records Center 


Track the issue status and respond at: https://cityoftampa.govqa.us/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=78694

communications.subject: Confirms Receipt
communications.communication:
Dear Public Records Request Submitter;

This message confirms receipt of your public records request by the Massachusetts Department of Criminal Justice Information Services (DCJIS).  The DCJIS will provide a formal response to your request for information as soon as possible.
Please note that the DCJIS may contact you with questions about your request or to clarify its scope.

In the interim, if you have any questions about the status of your request, please contact the DCJIS legal department at 617-660-4760 and ask to speak to Ms. Agapi Koulouris, the DCJIS General Counsel and Records Access Officer.

Thank you.

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

I have located this data at the following link: https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

However, the data at this link does not contain the full text of the initiative/referendum. In addition, it contains only information on elections dating back to 1986, while I request data for elections dating back to 1972.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Secretary of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)


I have located a potential data source from your state at the following link: https://electionstats.state.ma.us/ballot_questions/search/year_from:1972/year_to:2022/type:is_local
However, the data at this link does not contain information on the election date or threshold above. In addition, it contains only information on elections after 2002, while I request data for elections since 1972.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Connecticut Secretary of State, Legislation and Elections Administration Division)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)


I have located a potential data source from your state at the following link: https://electionhistory.ct.gov/eng/ballot_questions/search/year_from:1845/year_to:2023/text:bond/ballot_question_type:Local%20Question
However, the data at this link does not contain information on election date or threshold. I am also wondering if this is the exhaustive list of local questions.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

communications.subject: RE: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Department of Elections)
communications.communication:
Dear Johnathan Rudenberg –

The Department has received your FOIA request, below.  Please be advised the Department does not possess any records responsive to your request.  Delaware does not include ballot initiatives/referenda on ballots.

The Department does not maintain municipal election records.  For these records you may wish to contact Delaware’s municipalities.  Links to Delaware’s municipalities’ websites are available on the Department’s Municipal Elections webpage, https://elections.delaware.gov/municipality/index.shtml.

Thank you very much.

Best,


Cathleen Hartsky-Carter

Community Relations Officer/FOIA Coordinator

State of Delaware Department of Elections

905 S Governors Ave, Suite 170

Dover, DE 19904

302-739-4277

https://elections.delaware.gov<https://elections.delaware.gov/>

https://ivote.de.gov<https://ivote.de.gov/>

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (secretary of state)
communications.communication:
In Wisconsin, voter registration and elections are overseen by the Elections Commission, not the Secretary of State Office.  You can contact Elections for further information at 608-266-8005 or via https://elections.wi.gov/

The legislature in Wisconsin has control over setting elections in Wisconsin.  I would advise you to reach out to your legislator if you have any concerns.  If you are unsure who may represent you, you can find your legislator through maps.legis.wisconsin.gov<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__maps.legis.wisconsin.gov_&d=DwMFAg&c=HhgxO5mnlCoNHjwVH-wED6Mwc4Z-psO9z_38k9ow5oI&r=Ir5BBZ1NfD0SXloKv7gtezQ105JY2_LIwTRmx61iGs4&m=WYvXcrE7Fbeul6YSl_nb4u9rJAnZ2vme7VO2Q21rXf0&s=aRDj_iVorNyKKUnzsfudlovLPtKlgdbLfwqIiYjok4Q&e=>.  Use the search box in the upper right corner to enter your address.
Best,

Jessa

communications.subject: FW: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Secretary of State)
communications.communication:
Good morning:

The Delaware Department of State received your FOIA request submitted on March 6, 2024. See the complete request below.

With this email, I am forwarding the FOIA request to Rony Baltazar, Department of State's Director of Policy and Communications for review and response.

Please note that pursuant to 29 Del. C. § 10003(h)(1) "The public body shall respond to a FOIA request as soon as possible, but in any event within 15 business days after the receipt thereof, either by providing access to the requested records, denying access to the records or parts of them, or by advising that additional time is needed because the request is for voluminous records, requires legal advice, or a record is in storage or archived. If access cannot be provided within 15 business days, the public body shall cite 1 of the reasons hereunder why more time is needed and provide a good-faith estimate of how much additional time is required to fulfill the request."



Thank you,
Tammy Stock
FOIA Coordinator – Delaware Department of State

communications.subject: Thank you for contacting our office
communications.communication:
If you need to update your voter registration, you can do so online by visiting www.GoVoteColorado.gov<http://www.GoVoteColorado.gov>.

If you need to mail a voter registration form, we recommend sending it directly to your county clerk and recorder. County contact information is available on our website at https://www.coloradosos.gov/pubs/elections/Resources/CountyElectionOffices.html.

We’ll respond to your inquiry as quickly as possible.

Thank you.

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Wyoming Elections Division)

communications.subject: Wyoming Public Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Wyoming Elections Division)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wyoming Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

This website from California provides a good example of the type of data I am requesting:
https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han
